answers.author: Roger Stingl
answers.text:
The City of Wauwatosa does its own fleet maintenance. A study completed about contracting-out left out a lot of variables which can drive the cost of a repairs to unmanageable expenses especially regarding the specialized equipment.
Energy efficient vehicles are not cost effective and are problematic in a climate with extreme weather conditions.
The City of Wauwatosa does a 5-year projection on replacement vehicles using cost and mileage (plus engine hours).This gives one a snap shot to see if a particular vehicle is costing more to operate than reasonable.
City vehicles are assigned to a given department but some specialized equipment is shared between departments.
If you would like further information I can be contacted at home 414-475-0633.
Roger Stingl- Retired

answers.author: Scott Bingham
answers.text:
The State of Utah extended their replacement criteria and will save $1.82 Million annually.  We found that the vehicles are now more than ever able to handle an extended service life with no significant catastrophic failures.  Our study culminated a 2 and 1/2 year study in which every aspect of fleet management was verified, and indicated the move would save money.  We are based on a 105,000 mile replacement, with the average vehicle age at 7 years.  We have been utilizing this extension for 2 years and have yet to see any significant negative side effects.

author: Priscilla Cuddy
text:
As in all of government, we are looking for ways to improve service while lowering costs. What improvements have you made in the management of your fleet? Police cars? Other?
Some areas of inquiry:
Do you do your own maintenance or contract it out? Results?
Have you purchased and used energy efficient vehicles? Results?
How long do you keep vehicles in operation? By milage? By time?
Do you have permanently assigned vehicles or are they all pooled? Results
title: Fleet Management
